Not only are there a wide variety of Dyson vacuum models, but what comes with each model also varies greatly depending on where you buy it. You may choose between the V12 Absolute and the Absolute Plus in the United Kingdom, with the latter featuring an extra mattress tool. However, the United States offers both a regular and an Absolute model, but the United Kingdom offers neither of these options. In contrast to the Plus model, the Absolute model in the UK includes a mattress tool, a soft dusting brush, and an up-top adaptor. Moreover, peek at how countries like France receive their accessories, and you'll notice they're a little different. These extras are in addition to the basics that appear to come with every V12 vacuum, which we'll get to in a moment.


● Dimensions and Appearance of the V12 Detect Slim

● There is no need to hold a button down while vacuuming.

● Waste Receptacle, 0.35 liter



You may choose between Eco, Medium, and Boost when using the vacuum.


There is no mistaking that the Dyson V12 Detect Slim is a Dyson from its aesthetics alone. And that is precisely what it is trying to do with its outward form. The moment someone walks through the door, they will know that you have a DYSON and not just any regular cordless cleaner, thanks to its elaborate color scheme and unusual form.



It looks like a Dyson laser gun, which is to say, it has that shape. The handle is identical to previous V models; however, unlike those models, you don't have to hold down the trigger while vacuuming with this one. It makes a huge impact; the usability is greatly improved.


However, it sacrifices some battery safety in favor of convenience. If you want to extend the battery's life, turn it off while not using the vacuum. Turn it off whenever you have to halt rearranging furniture.


The off switch, a large red button shaped like a clown's nose, is located far from the trigger; thus, disabling it will need both hands. It's perched atop the apparatus. The button to choose between Eco, Medium, and Boost vacuuming modes is also in a strange place: it's just under the color display.


The 0.35-liter trash can is simple to empty but requires removing the wand. Even though the bin opens and dislodges its contents with a simple sliding mechanism, you will likely have to remove the final few tangles of hair and fluff balls by hand. Remember that the filter might get clogged easily if you have a lot of pet hair to vacuum up. The good news is that it can be removed and cleaned by hand.


The Effectiveness of the Dyson V12 Detect Slim


The V10 Laser's ability to attract dust and fluff with its intense beam of light is matched by the suction power of the same name. The time remaining in each mode is displayed on the LCD.


The suction on the V12 is 150 AW, the same as Dyson's other 2018 cordless vacuum release, the V10. You won't need anything stronger unless you have a deep pile of carpets and a lot of dogs, but this is sufficient for hard floors and most carpets.


The trade-off between its power, weight, and price makes it a worthy vacuum cleaner.


The V12 Detect's marquee features to set it different from other cordless Dyson vacuum cleaners. The primary Laser Slim Fluffy cleaner head has a green laser that shines onto the floor before you, highlighting any dust, debris, or spills you may have missed (although you can switch it off).


However, that is exactly the case. Having noticed a marked improvement in my field of vision by turning off the lights, we now do it before cleaning. We have a long-haired cat whose abundant coat covers more of the floor than the animal. The issue of pet hair is perpetual. The laser's pinpoint accuracy greatly aided this.


The main problems with the laser are


 (a) how embarrassing it is if you haven't vacuumed in a while and

 (b) how it will show you every single hair you missed when you just cleaned the room ten minutes ago. Maybe a bit too much information was revealed.


What extras might We expect to find in my V12 Detect Slim's box?


Two essential add-ons are the Hair Screw tool as well as Laser Slim Fluffy cleaning head.

The availability of further extras varies greatly from nation to country and model to model.


Accessories are plentiful in the Absolute + in the UK and Absolute in the US.


Accessories for your Dyson might change based on your location and the specific model you purchase. The two most important are the Hair Screw tool, which twirls hair away and into the trash, and the Laser Slim Fluffy cleaning head. You will find it quite useful if you constantly have to pluck or trim long hairs from the roller of your vacuum cleaner.


The Absolute (£529.99) and the Absolute Plus (£559.99) are both available in the United Kingdom. The former includes a docking station, a charger, and a set of attachments that include the Laser Slim Fluffy cleaner head, the Hair Screw tool, and the Motorbar cleaning head, a crevice tool, a combination tool, and an above adapter.


Accessories for the Dyson V12 Absolute, such as additional cleaning heads and a wall dock


The Absolute Plus has a wand clip and a mattress tool for getting into tight crevices in upholstery.


When purchased in the United States, the V12 Detect comes along with several attachments and accessories, including the Laser Slim Fluffy cleaner head, the Hair Screw tool, the Motorbar cleaning head, a crevice tool, a combination tool, a wand clip, a docking station, and a charger.


The gold-colored Absolute version comes with a tiny soft dusting brush, a fabric and mattress tool, and an up-top adaptor (to form an angle between cleaning attachment and vacuum).

Battery life of the Dyson V12 Detects Slim.


● As much as an hour

● Fast-charging time of 4 hours


Alternate Power Source


The battery life is not compromised in any way. The Dyson V12 has a maximum duration of 60 minutes and does not fade with time, matching the runtimes of the Dyson V11 and V15. In other words, there will be no reduction in suction or other indication that the device has run out of power.


To reach the full 60 minutes, however, you must use the Eco setting in conjunction with a non-motorized attachment. For example, when using the High Torque cleaning head on Eco mode, we only obtained around 46 minutes of run time, but with the Combination tool attached, we got the whole hour.


The Laser Slim Fluffy's maximum fade-free runtime was 40 minutes in Auto mode and 20 minutes in Boost mode. And that's quite like the features provided by the V15 Detect.


If you anticipate needing more than 60 minutes of use, you may always buy an extra battery pack to use in emergencies.


Should I go ahead and get the Dyson V12 Detect Slim?


Invest in it if...


1. You want a laser-lit Dyson, but you don't want to spend the asking price.


Even while it may seem like a gimmick at first, the Laser Slim Fluffy may be put to good use when searching for dust and debris that may have accumulated under furniture or in nooks and crannies that are generally difficult to access. This feature sets the V15 Detect apart from the competition, and you also receive it with the V12 Detect Slim by default.


2. You have a little home to call your own.


The bin capacity of the V12 Detect Slim is sufficient for a home with a single bedroom; however, if your home has more than one bedroom, particularly if some (or all) of the rooms have carpeting, you may need to halt regular vacuuming sessions to empty the bin more frequently. If that doesn't sound like something you'd be interested in doing, you might want to think about purchasing one of the Dyson V11 models instead, which are all available for about the same amount of money.


3. It would help if you got Dyson's most recent cordless vacuum cleaner.


When it comes to vacuum cleaners, Dyson is without a doubt the most well-known brand and is also among the most desirable options available. If the V15 Detect is beyond your price range, the V12 Detect Slim can be a suitable option, provided that you can make do with its smaller bin and less suction power.


You shouldn't purchase it if...


1. You require a vacuum cleaner with increased suction force.


Variations in the amount of suction power may be found in each Dyson. The V15 Detect is the most influential model to date; however, the V11, which has 14 radial cyclones, is also somewhat more strong than the V12 Detect Slim. And considering the fact that they both feature increased bin sizes, they are both far better choices for anybody seeking a fantastic new Dyson machine.


2. You are restricted financially in some way.


Even though it is more affordable than the V15 Detect, the V12 Detect Slim is still pretty pricey. We would not think twice about recommending the Dyson V10 Cyclone to someone on a more limited budget because it has the same amount of suction power as the V12, comes with a larger bin, and is priced far lower than any of the more recent versions.



3. You require a bin can that is both bigger and cleaner.


It might not seem like a big thing to empty the trash can regularly, but if you have to stick your fingers in there to take out tangles of hair and clumps of fluff, it is not ideal. The V12 Detect Slim suffers from this issue, our primary concern.


Final Thoughts


Amazingly, all of the technology that contributed to the V15 Detect's superior performance was crammed into a smaller and more affordable cleaner. This is an excellent option for people with more compact homes or who want a cordless stick vacuum to supplement a bigger model. Check out my guide to the best cordless vacuum cleaners if you are looking for a cleaner completely different from the others on the market.
